item.title: Covid vaccine set to be offered to 16 and 17-year-olds
item.description: More than one million teenagers would be included in a new rollout if ministers accept expert advice.

item.title: Migrant Channel crossings: 284 people reach the UK
item.description: The Home Office says the rising number of people making the "dangerous" crossing is unacceptable.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Where are Team GBâ€™s English medallists from?
item.description: With day 11 of the competition over, the North West currently leads the way when it comes to medals.

item.title: Ever Given: Cargo ship that blocked Suez Canal arrives in Felixstowe
item.description: The Ever Given docks at the Port of Felixstowe months after it was originally due to arrive.

item.title: Bradford child sexual abuse: 19 men arrested
item.description: The inquiry is connected to offences against one female in Bradford between 2000-2005, police say.

item.title: Basketball: Chatham teenager gets scholarship to play for top US side
item.description: Tamara Fournillier-Onadeko, who plays at youth level in the GB squad, is heading to Chicago.

item.title: Vigil held for sisters murdered in park
item.description: Family and friends gather at a vigil to honour women lost to male violence.

item.title: Boy, 5, dies after department store head injury
item.description: Police say specialist officers are supporting the boy's family following his death.

item.title: Tom Miller: Hiding student fell to death at illegal lockdown party
item.description: Rumours of a police raid prompted Tom Miller to climb out of a window, an inquest hears.

item.title: Aya Hachem: Seven men guilty of drive-by shooting murder
item.description: Innocent passer-by Aya Hachem, 19, was shot dead in a feud between two Blackburn tyre firm owners.

item.title: Award for 'Covid hero' Taunton dressmaker who made PPE
item.description: The Taunton Scrubbers was made up of 800 volunteers from across Somerset at its peak.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: Ever Given: Time-lapse video captures Felixstowe arrival
item.description: "We could still see Egyptian sand on its bow," said film-maker Brian Abrams as the ship docked.

item.title: Bank scam victims speak of trouble getting refunds
item.description: Some banks are not refunding customers' losses as they should be under a new code, a regulator says.

item.title: Climate change: Girl, six, riding scooter to save rainforests
item.description: Aleesha, from Nottingham, is praised by Sir David Attenborough, the prime minister and the Queen.

item.title: Assisted dying: Campaigners renewed hope for change in the law
item.description: David Peace intends to travel abroad to end his life before his motor neurone disease deteriorates further.

item.title: 'I want to be like Tom Daley'
item.description: Young divers describe how Olympic medallist Tom Daley inspired them to take up the sport.

item.title: Ex-Warwickshire Police officer convicted of second charge
item.description: Alan Butler was charged after relationships he had with two women whose cases he was involved in.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 13-year-old Sky Brown wins Olympic skateboarding bronze
item.description: Sky Brown wins bronze in the women's park skateboarding final at the Tokyo Games, making the 13-year-old Great Britain's youngest Olympic medallist of all time.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sky Brown becomes GB's youngest medallist, plus sailing and boxing success
item.description: Sky Brown wins bronze and becomes Great Britain's youngest summer Olympian with success also coming in sailing and boxing.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB sailors Hannah Mills and Eilidh McIntyre win 470 gold
item.description: Hannah Mills becomes the most successful female sailor in Olympic history as she and Eilidh McIntyre win 470 gold at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain's Ben Whittaker wins boxing silver after defeat by Arlen Lopez
item.description: Ben Whittaker wins Great Britain's second silver of the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games after losing to Cuba's Arlen Lopez in the light-heavyweight gold-medal bout.
